'''Stye=''''' furuncle of the free edge of the eyelid centred on a pilosebaceous follicle of the eyelash.

It corresponds to a bacterial infection, most often with Staphylococcus aureus, of the pilosebaceous follicle. It develops over a few days and can cause severe pain. Clinically, it appears as a red swelling centred by a white dot at the free edge. Secretions are not always present at first.

question.title: What is a stye?
question.description: A type of infection on the eyelid

option_a.title: A small bump on the eyelid caused by a skin infection

option_b.title: A furuncle of the free edge of the eyelid centred on a pilosebaceous follicle of the eyelash
option_b.description: A bacterial infection of the pilosebaceous follicle

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The letter of the correct option
